body-fat-percentage-calculator.title: Body Fat Percentage Calculator - Free Online Fat Tracker
body-fat-percentage-calculator.description: Calculate your body fat percentage accurately. Free online tool to track body composition based on gender and age.

howItWorks.title: How the Body Fat Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: U.S. Navy Method: Body Fat % (Men) = 86.010 × log10(waist - neck) - 70.041 × log10(height) + 36.76
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator uses the U.S. Navy Method to estimate body fat percentage based on body circumference measurements. This method is accurate and easy to use without specialized equipment, providing a reliable estimate of body composition.

steps.name: Enter Data
steps.text: Input your gender, height, weight, and circumference measurements

steps.name: Calculate
steps.text: The calculator applies the U.S. Navy formula to your measurements

steps.name: View Results
steps.text: Get your body fat percentage and health category classification

useCases.title: Weight Loss Tracking
useCases.description: Used by dieters to track fat loss, not just weight loss

useCases.title: Bodybuilding
useCases.description: Monitor body fat during bulking and cutting phases

useCases.title: General Health Assessment
useCases.description: Determine if your body fat is within a healthy range

seoTips: Measure waist at navel level for accurate readings
Take measurements in the morning before eating for consistency
Use a flexible, non-stretchable measuring tape
Take 3 measurements and use the average for better accuracy
commonMistakes: Pulling the tape too tight, giving inaccurate readings
Measuring over clothing instead of directly on skin
Not standing straight during measurement
Comparing results between different measurement methods

faqs.question: What is a healthy body fat percentage?
faqs.answer: For men: 10-20% is healthy. For women: 18-28% is healthy. Athletes may have lower percentages.

faqs.question: How often should I measure body fat?
faqs.answer: Every 2-4 weeks is recommended to effectively track changes.

faqs.question: How accurate is this method?
faqs.answer: The U.S. Navy Method is accurate within ±3-4% compared to lab methods.

faqs.question: Why do men and women have different ranges?
faqs.answer: Women biologically need higher body fat for hormonal and reproductive functions.

lean-body-mass-calculator.title: Lean Body Mass Calculator - Calculate Muscle Mass
lean-body-mass-calculator.description: Calculate your lean muscle mass accurately. Free online lean body mass calculator for fitness and bodybuilding tracking.
lean-body-mass-calculator.weight_tooltip: Enter your body weight in kilograms
lean-body-mass-calculator.waist_tooltip: Measure around your waist at navel level
lean-body-mass-calculator.tips_list: Regular exercise increases lean mass, adequate protein supports muscle maintenance, strength training helps preserve LBM as you age
lean-body-mass-calculator.empty_state: Enter your measurements to calculate lean body mass
lean-body-mass-calculator.footer_note: Calculations use the U.S. Navy Method. Results are estimates.

ideal-weight-calculator.title: Ideal Weight Calculator - Free Healthy Weight Tool
ideal-weight-calculator.description: Calculate your ideal healthy weight based on height, gender, and age. Free online weight target calculator.

howItWorks.title: How the Ideal Weight Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Devine Formula: Men = 50 + 2.3 × (height in inches - 60), Women = 45.5 + 2.3 × (height in inches - 60)
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator uses multiple scientifically-validated formulas to calculate ideal weight based on your height and gender. It combines Devine, Robinson, and Miller formulas to give you a realistic healthy weight range.

steps.name: Enter Information
steps.text: Input your height, gender, and age

steps.name: Apply Formulas
steps.text: The tool calculates your ideal weight using multiple formulas

steps.name: View Results
steps.text: Get your ideal weight range with health recommendations

useCases.title: Setting Weight Loss Goals
useCases.description: Determine a realistic and healthy target weight

useCases.title: Fitness Planning
useCases.description: For athletes who need to reach a specific weight for competitions

useCases.title: General Health Assessment
useCases.description: Evaluate if your current weight is within a healthy range

seoTips: Ideal weight varies based on body frame size (small, medium, large)
Focus on a healthy range rather than a single number
Muscle mass may make your weight higher than ideal - this is normal for athletes
Consult a doctor to determine the best weight for your health condition
commonMistakes: Pursuing unrealistic weights based only on aesthetic standards
Ignoring muscle mass when evaluating weight
Comparing your weight to people with different heights and frames
Trying to reach ideal weight too quickly

faqs.question: Is ideal weight the same for everyone of the same height?
faqs.answer: No, it varies by gender, bone structure, and muscle mass.

faqs.question: Can I be healthy at a weight above the ideal?
faqs.answer: Yes, especially if you have high muscle mass or a large bone structure.

faqs.question: How do I reach my ideal weight healthily?
faqs.answer: Through gradual diet adjustments and exercise, at a rate of 0.5-1 kg per week.

waist-to-hip-ratio-calculator.title: Waist-to-Hip Ratio Calculator - Free Health Risk Tool
waist-to-hip-ratio-calculator.description: Calculate your waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) to assess health risks and body fat distribution. Free online health assessment.

howItWorks.title: How the Waist-to-Hip Ratio Calculator Works
howItWorks.explanation: This ratio measures body fat distribution and is an important indicator of health risks. Fat accumulated around the abdomen (apple shape) is more dangerous than fat around the hips (pear shape).

steps.name: Measure Waist
steps.text: Measure your waist at the narrowest point above your navel

steps.name: Measure Hips
steps.text: Measure your hips at the widest point

steps.name: Calculate Ratio
steps.text: The calculator divides waist by hip and evaluates the result

useCases.title: Heart Disease Risk Assessment
useCases.description: High ratios correlate with increased cardiovascular disease risk

useCases.title: Fat Distribution Tracking
useCases.description: Monitor changes in fat distribution during weight loss programs

useCases.title: Preventive Health Screening
useCases.description: A preliminary screening tool for obesity-related health risks

seoTips: Measure at the same time of day for consistent readings
Do not suck in your stomach during measurement
Use a mirror or ask for help to get an accurate measurement
Record measurements monthly to track progress
commonMistakes: Measuring waist at the navel instead of the narrowest point
Holding breath or sucking in stomach during measurement
Measuring over thick clothing
Not keeping the tape level around the body

faqs.question: What is a healthy WHR for men and women?
faqs.answer: For men: less than 0.9 is healthy. For women: less than 0.85 is healthy.

faqs.question: Why is belly fat more dangerous?
faqs.answer: It's associated with visceral fat that surrounds organs and increases risk of diabetes and heart disease.

faqs.question: Can I improve this ratio?
faqs.answer: Yes, through aerobic exercise, calorie reduction, and core exercises.

body-frame-size-calculator.title: Body Frame Size Calculator - Small, Medium, or Large
body-frame-size-calculator.description: Calculate your body frame size accurately. Free online tool to determine bone structure for realistic weight goals.

howItWorks.title: How the Body Frame Size Calculator Works
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator determines your bone structure size based on the ratio of your height to wrist circumference. Knowing your frame size is important for determining a realistic ideal weight range for you.

steps.name: Measure Height
steps.text: Measure your height accurately in centimeters

steps.name: Measure Wrist
steps.text: Measure your wrist circumference at the narrowest point below the wrist bone

steps.name: Determine Frame
steps.text: The tool calculates the ratio and classifies your frame (small, medium, large)

useCases.title: Determining Ideal Weight
useCases.description: Adjust your ideal weight range based on your bone structure

useCases.title: Fitness Planning
useCases.description: Set realistic goals for muscle mass and weight

useCases.title: Better Body Understanding
useCases.description: Understand why your weight differs from others of the same height

seoTips: Measure wrist at the narrowest point for accuracy
A large frame means your natural weight will be higher
Bone structure cannot be changed
Use this information to adjust ideal weight expectations
commonMistakes: Measuring above the prominent wrist bone
Using the dominant hand which may be slightly larger
Measuring after exercise when blood vessels are dilated
Confusing frame size with body fat percentage

faqs.question: Can body frame size be changed?
faqs.answer: No, frame size is genetic and cannot be changed through exercise or diet.

faqs.question: How does frame size affect ideal weight?
faqs.answer: Larger frames naturally support more weight, with differences up to 5-10 kg.

faqs.question: Why measure the wrist specifically?
faqs.answer: The wrist has minimal fat and muscle, so it accurately reflects bone size.

body-recomposition-calculator.title: Body Recomposition Calculator - Build Muscle & Lose Fat
body-recomposition-calculator.description: Calculate requirements for simultaneous muscle growth and fat loss. Free online body recomposition guide.

howItWorks.title: How the Body Recomposition Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Training Day Calories = TDEE + 10-20%, Rest Day Calories = TDEE - 10-20%
howItWorks.explanation: Body recomposition is building muscle and losing fat simultaneously. It works through calorie cycling: a slight surplus on training days to build muscle, and a slight deficit on rest days to burn fat.

steps.name: Calculate TDEE
steps.text: Input your maintenance calories

steps.name: Set Training Days
steps.text: Specify the number of weight training days weekly

steps.name: Calculate Calories
steps.text: The tool calculates calories for training and rest days

useCases.title: Beginners
useCases.description: Beginners can build muscle and burn fat more easily

useCases.title: Returning to Training
useCases.description: Those who stopped training for a while benefit from recomposition

useCases.title: Those Who Don't Want to Bulk
useCases.description: For those who want to improve body composition without weight gain

seoTips: Recomposition is slower than separate bulking or cutting
High protein is essential (2+ g/kg)
Strength training is more important than cardio for recomposition
Sleep and recovery are essential for success
commonMistakes: Expecting quick results like bulking or cutting
Not eating enough protein
Too much cardio and neglecting weights
Impatience and switching between approaches

faqs.question: Is recomposition possible for everyone?
faqs.answer: Easier for beginners and those with excess fat, harder for advanced trainees.

faqs.question: How long until results?
faqs.answer: 3-6 months to notice significant changes in body composition.

faqs.question: Does weight change?
faqs.answer: It may stay the same as muscle replaces fat.

howItWorks.title: How the Body Fat Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: U.S. Navy Method: Body Fat % (Men) = 86.010 × log10(waist - neck) - 70.041 × log10(height) + 36.76
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator uses the U.S. Navy Method to estimate body fat percentage from circumference measurements. This method is accurate, easy to perform without specialized equipment, and provides reliable estimates of body composition.

useCases.description: Track body fat during bulking and cutting phases to optimize results

seoTips: Measure waist at navel level, keeping the tape horizontal for consistency
Take measurements in the morning before eating for the most accurate readings
Use a flexible, non-stretchable measuring tape for all measurements
Take three measurements and use the average to improve accuracy
commonMistakes: Pulling the measuring tape too tight, resulting in artificially low readings
Measuring over clothing instead of directly on skin
Not standing straight and relaxed during measurements
Comparing results from different measurement methods (Navy, calipers, DEXA)

faqs.question: What is a healthy body fat percentage?
faqs.answer: For men: 10-20% is healthy. For women: 18-28% is healthy. Athletes may have lower percentages.

faqs.question: How often should I measure body fat?
faqs.answer: Every 2-4 weeks is recommended to effectively track changes without daily fluctuations.

faqs.question: How accurate is the Navy Method?
faqs.answer: The U.S. Navy Method is accurate within 3-4% compared to laboratory methods like DEXA.

lean_body_mass.title: Lean Body Mass Calculator
lean_body_mass.description: Calculate your lean muscle mass accurately. Free online lean body mass calculator for fitness and bodybuilding tracking.
lean_body_mass.about_desc: Lean Body Mass (LBM) is the amount of weight you carry on your body that isn't fat. The goal of any bodybuilder or fitness enthusiast is to drop weight while keeping your lean body mass the same.
lean_body_mass.empty_state: Enter your measurements to calculate lean body mass
lean_body_mass.footer_note: Calculations based on the U.S. Navy Method.

howItWorks.title: How the Lean Body Mass Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Lean Body Mass = Total Weight - Fat Mass, where Fat Mass = Weight × Body Fat Percentage
howItWorks.explanation: Lean Body Mass (LBM) represents everything in your body except fat, including muscles, bones, organs, and water. This calculator first estimates your body fat percentage using the Navy Method, then calculates your lean mass by subtracting fat mass from total weight.

steps.name: Enter Measurements
steps.text: Input your gender, height, weight, and circumference measurements

steps.name: Calculate Body Fat
steps.text: The tool estimates body fat percentage using the U.S. Navy formula

steps.name: View Lean Mass
steps.text: Get your lean body mass, fat mass, and percentage breakdown

useCases.title: Bodybuilding Progress
useCases.description: Track muscle retention during cutting phases and muscle gains during bulking

useCases.title: Weight Loss Quality
useCases.description: Ensure weight loss comes from fat, not muscle mass

useCases.title: Protein Requirements
useCases.description: Calculate protein needs based on lean mass rather than total weight

seoTips: Preserving lean mass during weight loss requires adequate protein intake (1.6-2.2g per kg of lean mass)
Resistance training is essential for maintaining lean mass during calorie deficits
Losing more than 1kg per week often means losing muscle along with fat
Track lean mass monthly rather than weekly for meaningful trend analysis
commonMistakes: Focusing only on scale weight without considering body composition
Not eating enough protein during weight loss, leading to muscle loss
Excessive cardio without resistance training, which reduces lean mass
Expecting lean mass to increase significantly while in a calorie deficit

faqs.question: What is a good lean body mass percentage?
faqs.answer: For men: 75-85% lean mass is typical. For women: 68-78%. Athletes often have higher percentages.

faqs.question: Can I build lean mass while losing fat?
faqs.answer: Yes, especially if you are a beginner, returning after a break, or have higher body fat. This is called body recomposition.

faqs.question: How do I preserve lean mass during weight loss?
faqs.answer: Eat adequate protein, maintain strength training, avoid extreme calorie deficits, and lose weight gradually.

body_frame.title: Body Frame Size Calculator
body_frame.description: Calculate your body frame size accurately based on height and wrist circumference.

descriptions.small: Your bone structure is smaller than average for your height.
descriptions.medium: Your bone structure is average for your height.
descriptions.large: Your bone structure is larger than average for your height.

body_frame.tips_desc: Body frame size helps determine your ideal body weight range more accurately. Larger frames naturally carry more weight.
body_frame.empty_state: Enter your height and wrist circumference to calculate frame size
body_frame.footer_note: Based on the ratio of height to wrist circumference.

howItWorks.title: How the Body Frame Size Calculator Works
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator determines your bone structure size by analyzing the ratio between your height and wrist circumference. The wrist is used because it has minimal fat and muscle, providing an accurate indicator of bone size. Knowing your frame size helps set realistic weight goals.

steps.name: Measure Height
steps.text: Measure your height accurately in centimeters

steps.name: Measure Wrist
steps.text: Measure wrist circumference at the narrowest point below the wrist bone

steps.name: Determine Frame
steps.text: The calculator computes the ratio and classifies your frame as small, medium, or large

useCases.title: Ideal Weight Adjustment
useCases.description: Adjust your target weight range based on bone structure for realistic goals

useCases.title: Fitness Goal Setting
useCases.description: Set appropriate muscle mass and weight targets for your natural build

useCases.title: Body Understanding
useCases.description: Understand why your weight may differ from others of the same height

seoTips: Measure wrist at the narrowest point below the prominent wrist bone for accuracy
A large frame means your natural healthy weight will be higher than charts suggest
Frame size is genetic and cannot be changed through diet or exercise
Use frame size to adjust ideal weight calculator results for more realistic targets
commonMistakes: Measuring wrist above the prominent bone instead of at the narrowest point
Using the dominant hand which may be slightly larger from use
Measuring after exercise when blood flow may temporarily increase size
Confusing frame size with body fat percentage or muscle mass

faqs.question: Can body frame size be changed?
faqs.answer: No, frame size is determined by genetics and skeletal structure. It cannot be altered through exercise or diet.

faqs.question: How does frame size affect ideal weight?
faqs.answer: Larger frames naturally support more weight. The difference can be 5-10 kg between small and large frames of the same height.

faqs.question: Why measure the wrist specifically?
faqs.answer: The wrist has minimal fat and muscle tissue, making it an accurate indicator of actual bone size.

body_recomposition.title: Body Recomposition Calculator
body_recomposition.description: Calculate requirements for simultaneous muscle growth and fat loss.
body_recomposition.training_days_tooltip: How many days you lift weights
body_recomposition.tip_cycle: Calorie cycling helps build muscle while minimizing fat gain
body_recomposition.tip_protein: High protein intake is crucial for muscle repair
body_recomposition.tip_patience: Body recomposition is slower than dedicated bulking or cutting
body_recomposition.empty_state: Enter your details to generate a body recomposition plan
body_recomposition.footer_note: Recomposition is most effective for beginners or those returning after a break.

howItWorks.title: How the Body Recomposition Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Training Days: TDEE + 10-20% surplus, Rest Days: TDEE - 10-20% deficit
howItWorks.explanation: Body recomposition involves building muscle while losing fat simultaneously. This is achieved through calorie cycling: eating a slight surplus on training days to fuel muscle growth, and a slight deficit on rest days to burn fat. Combined with high protein intake, this allows body composition changes without significant weight change.

steps.name: Calculate TDEE
steps.text: Enter your maintenance calorie level

steps.name: Set Training Schedule
steps.text: Specify how many days per week you weight train

steps.name: Get Cycling Plan
steps.text: Receive calorie targets for training days and rest days

useCases.title: Beginners
useCases.description: New lifters can build muscle and lose fat simultaneously due to beginner gains

useCases.title: Returning Athletes
useCases.description: Those returning after a break benefit from muscle memory and recomposition

useCases.title: Avoiding Bulk/Cut Cycles
useCases.description: For those who want to improve body composition without significant weight changes

seoTips: Recomposition is slower than dedicated bulking or cutting phases
High protein intake (2+ g/kg) is essential for recomposition success
Strength training is more important than cardio for recomposition
Adequate sleep and recovery are critical for the process to work
commonMistakes: Expecting rapid results like traditional bulking or cutting
Not consuming enough protein to support muscle protein synthesis
Doing too much cardio and neglecting resistance training
Being impatient and constantly switching between different approaches

faqs.question: Can everyone do body recomposition?
faqs.answer: It is easiest for beginners and those with higher body fat. Advanced lean athletes may need traditional bulk/cut cycles.

faqs.question: How long until I see results?
faqs.answer: Expect 3-6 months to notice significant changes in body composition through recomposition.

faqs.question: Will my weight change?
faqs.answer: Weight may stay similar or change slightly since muscle replaces fat. Focus on measurements and appearance rather than scale weight.

waist_hip_ratio.title: Waist-to-Hip Ratio Calculator
waist_hip_ratio.description: Calculate your waist-to-hip ratio to assess health risks.
waist_hip_ratio.tip_activity: Regular cardio exercise helps reduce visceral fat
waist_hip_ratio.tip_diet: A balanced diet rich in fiber supports healthy weight
waist_hip_ratio.empty_state: Enter your measurements to calculate WHR
waist_hip_ratio.footer_note: WHR is a simple but effective indicator of health risks related to fat distribution.
waist_hip_ratio.gender_tooltip: Select gender for more accurate result interpretation

howItWorks.title: How the Waist-to-Hip Ratio Calculator Works
howItWorks.explanation: The waist-to-hip ratio measures how fat is distributed in your body and is an important indicator of health risks. Fat accumulated around the abdomen (apple shape) poses greater health risks than fat stored around the hips and thighs (pear shape).

steps.name: Measure Waist
steps.text: Measure your waist at the narrowest point, typically above the navel

steps.name: Measure Hips
steps.text: Measure your hips at the widest point around the buttocks

steps.name: Calculate Ratio
steps.text: The calculator divides waist by hip measurement and assesses your risk level

useCases.title: Cardiovascular Risk Assessment
useCases.description: Higher ratios correlate with increased risk of heart disease and stroke

useCases.title: Fat Distribution Tracking
useCases.description: Monitor changes in body fat distribution during weight loss programs

useCases.title: Health Screening
useCases.description: Simple preliminary screening tool for obesity-related health risks

seoTips: Measure at the same time of day for consistent and comparable readings
Do not suck in your stomach or hold your breath during measurement
Use a mirror or ask for help to ensure the tape is level around your body
Record measurements monthly to track progress over time
commonMistakes: Measuring waist at the navel instead of the narrowest point
Holding breath or sucking in the stomach during measurement
Measuring over thick clothing instead of on bare skin or thin clothing
Not keeping the measuring tape horizontal and level around the body

faqs.question: What is a healthy WHR?
faqs.answer: For men: below 0.9 is healthy. For women: below 0.85 is healthy. Higher values indicate increased health risk.

faqs.question: Why is abdominal fat more dangerous?
faqs.answer: Visceral fat around organs is metabolically active and linked to increased risk of diabetes, heart disease, and certain cancers.

faqs.question: Can I improve my WHR?
faqs.answer: Yes, through regular aerobic exercise, calorie reduction, and core strengthening exercises to reduce waist circumference.
